publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-3936 Patricia Ferguson: Welcome Help for Malawi’s Mums—That the Parliament notes the announcement by Secretary of State for International Development Douglas Alexander MP, of a £9 million increase in the Department for International Development’s health programme in Malawi; welcomes the fact that this money will be used to tackle problems suffered by women after complications during pregnancy and childbirth, and expresses the hope that maternal mortality rates in Malawi will decrease as a result of this investment.
S3M-3936 Welcome Help for Malawi’s Mums (lodged on 21 April 2009) Jamie Hepburn*

S3M-3936 Welcome Help for Malawi’s Mums (lodged on 21 April 2009) Des McNulty*, Jackie Baillie*, Mr Frank McAveety*, Hugh O’Donnell*, David Whitton*, Hugh Henry*, Helen Eadie*, Elaine Murray*, Jim Tolson*, Dr Richard Simpson*, Mike Pringle*, Cathy Jamieson*, Karen Gillon*, Bill Butler*, Sandra White*, Ted Brocklebank*

S3M-3936 Patricia Ferguson: Welcome Help for Malawi’s Mums—That the Parliament notes the announcement by Secretary of State for International Development Douglas Alexander MP of a £9 million increase in the Department for International Development’s health programme in Malawi; welcomes the fact that this money will be used to tackle problems suffered by women after complications during pregnancy and childbirth, and expresses the hope that maternal mortality rates in Malawi will decrease as a result of this investment. Supported by: Jamie Hepburn, Des McNulty, Jackie Baillie, Mr Frank McAveety, Hugh O’Donnell, David Whitton, Hugh Henry, Helen Eadie, Elaine Murray, Jim Tolson, Dr Richard Simpson, Mike Pringle, Cathy Jamieson, Karen Gillon, Bill Butler, Sandra White, Ted Brocklebank, Jack McConnell*, Robin Harper*, Kenneth Gibson*, Trish Godman*, Marlyn Glen*
S3M-3936 Welcome Help for Malawi’s Mums (lodged on 21 April 2009) Elaine Smith*, Mary Mulligan*
S3M-3936 Welcome Help for Malawi’s Mums (lodged on 21 April 2009) Rhoda Grant*, Ken Macintosh*, Karen Whitefield*
S3M-3936 Welcome Help for Malawi’s Mums (lodged on 21 April 2009) Sarah Boyack* Contents An A B C D E F G H I J
